newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonian shares close higher in lighter trade.
newsitem.headline: Estonian shares close higher in lighter trade.

text.p: Hoiupank was the most active stock on Estonia's Tallinn Stock Exchange on Friday with trading volumes were down compared to recent days, dealers said.
Total volume on the official list was 36.6 million kroons of shares and the Tallinn stock exchange index firmed slightly to close 0.84 percent higher at 214.78.
"It was a good day with Hoiupank and Hansapank leading with good buying pressure," one dealer said.
"Everyone had expected less foreign interest after the dive on Wall Street, however everyone was buying, even the foreigners."
Hoiupank registered a gain of 0.85 kroons to close at 106.25 kroons with 13.3 million kroons of shares traded.
Hansapank posted good increase to end trading 3.08 kroons higher on 216.08 after turning over over 7.1 million kroons of shares.
Forekspank picked up 0.15 kroons to end trading on 154.40 kroons after 5.1 million kroons of shares changed hands.
In other banking stocks, Tallinna Pank dipped slightly to close 0.05 lower at 60.65 kroons. Tallinna Pank turned over 3.7 million kroons worth of shares.
Union Bank was quiet again with only 1.3 million kroons of share changing hands to close 0.05 kroons lower on 44.90 kroons.
The free market registered a total volume of 5.2 million kroons of shares with Rakvere meat plant the most active stock.
Rakvere was 0.55 kroons lower at 13.25 kroons after shares worth 3.1 million kroons changed owners.
-- David Mardiste, Tallinn newsroom +372 630 8400 or reuters@reuters.ee
